metadata.subject: Financials: buy XLF Mar17 $22 call with $26 KO for $0.87 with full premium rebate on KO

organizations: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Incorporated

relationships.description: Financial advisor providing investment recommendations to client
Financial advisor providing investment recommendations to client

emotional_indicators: urgency to act on investment opportunity
analysis.purpose: To provide financial investment recommendations and market analysis regarding financial sector stocks following the 2016 election
analysis.significance: Shows financial advisory relationship and investment strategies being discussed post-2016 presidential election

notable_quotes: The market is certainly indicating that there will be a large fiscal stimulus which may send US growth higher and that's a good thing for financials

The move in the financials since the election would seem to indicate that investors have concluded that nearly every piece of financial regulation will get put into a shredder on day one of the new administration
Funds are underweight financials in all regions, valuations are reasonable, earnings are improving and financials tend to outperform when bond yields rise

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail, coercion, or leverage found in this financial advisory communication

illegal_activity.description: Document contains standard financial advisory communications and investment recommendations with no indication of illegal activity

details: Reference to Trump's 60 Minutes interview as market-moving event

public_knowledge.context: Standard financial market analysis and investment recommendations following 2016 election

analysis.summary: This email chain from a Bank of America Merrill Lynch director provides financial investment recommendations focused on financial sector stocks (XLF) following the 2016 presidential election, analyzing market reactions to anticipated regulatory changes and economic policies under the new administration.
